channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Skims founding partner Emma Grede schedules an ‘AI day’ once every six weeks to future-proof her career: ‘It’s like do or die’
item.description: Upskilling in AI is unavoidable as workers look to ‘future-proof our organizations and ourselves,’ Grede added.

item.title: ‘Don’t sell just because there’s a bubble,’ says Ray Dalio, but be prepared for low returns over be next 10 years
item.description: "I think the picture is pretty clear in that we are in that territory of a bubble, but we don't have the pricking of the bubble yet," Dalio said.

item.title: The Tariffs Aren’t Helping
item.description: Donald Trump is a wholeheartedly pro-manufacturing president, and he’s definitely here to help — with a dizzying array of tariffs.

item.title: Nuremberg in the Age of Lawfare
item.description: A warped history of justice, Tarantino-style.

item.title: House Dem serving since 1993 announces she won't seek re-election
item.description: Rep. Nydia Velázquez, a Democrat who has served in the U.S. House of Representatives for more than 30 years, announced that she will not run for re-el...

item.title: Is President Trump Thinking About Greenland Again?
item.description: Much-touted pharmaceutical deals could end up giving the president new leverage.

item.title: Federal judge orders release of 16 migrants detained in Idaho raid, citing due process violations
item.description: A federal judge has ordered the release of 16 people detained by immigration officials during an FBI-led raid at a rural Idaho racetrack last month.

item.title: New York Democratic Rep. Nydia Velazquez says she won't run for reelection in 2026
item.description: New York Rep. Nydia Velazquez - a trailblazer known by the nickname "La Luchadora" or the fighter - announced Thursday that she will retire next year ...

item.description: A lawsuit challenges fines of up to $1.8 million imposed on immigrants remaining in the U.S. illegally despite their efforts to comply with federal im...

item.title: Federal judges uphold several North Carolina U.S. House districts drawn by Republicans
item.description: Federal judges on Thursday upheld several U.S. House districts that North Carolina Republicans drew in 2023 that helped the GOP gain additional seats ...

item.title: Sam Altman’s eye-scanning orb startup says employees should only care about work—for the good of humanity—otherwise ‘you should just not be here’
item.description: “We work weekends, we're always on call, and we push as hard as our circumstances allow us to,” Tools for Humanity CEO Alex Blania said in a January s...

item.title: House GOP campaign chair wants Trump 'out there on the trail' in midterm battle for majority
item.description: GOP campaign chair calls Democratic 2025 election wins a "wake up call" for Republican voters ahead of crucial 2026 midterm elections and party strate...

item.title: What to know about Trump's draft proposal to curtail state AI regulations
item.description: President Donald Trump is considering pressuring states to stop regulating artificial intelligence in a draft executive order obtained Thursday by The...

item.title: Going Nuclear
item.description: The Trump administration is right to make nuclear power part of the U.S. energy solution.

item.title: The IPO market is being re-globalized as Asia’s markets embrace dual listings and corporate governance reform
item.description: Asian companies are increasingly exploring the possibility of listing in non-U.S. markets.

item.title: Muslim civil rights group CAIR sues Texas over Abbott's ‘terrorist’ designation
item.description: CAIR filed a federal lawsuit challenging Texas Gov. Greg Abbott's designation of the group as a "foreign terrorist organization" and "transnational cr...

item.title: Eric Swalwell announces run for California governor, vows to be 'protector and fighter'
item.description: Rep. Eric Swalwell, D-Calif., announced on Thursday he is launching a campaign for California governor in 2026.

item.title: Treasury plans to change tax credit eligibility in a move critics say will hurt immigrant taxpayers
item.description: The U.S. Treasury Department said Thursday it plans to reclassify certain refundable tax credits as "federal public benefits," which will bar some imm...

item.title: USA Rare Earth CEO describes ‘Manhattan Project’ to wean U.S. from dependence on China
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Duffy Threatens To Pull $75 Million In Road Funds After PA Gave An Alleged Terrorist A CDL
item.description: Non-domiciled CDL licenses should expire when the license holder’s time in the U.S. expires. PennDOT extended the dates, U.S. DOT says.

item.title: Trump’s Transportation Department Necessarily Brings Back Shaming, Thank God
item.description: The Trump administration’s Department of Transportation has brought back shaming, and anyone who flies even just once per year should fully support it...

item.title: Exclusive: GOP Leaders Grill Judge Boasberg For Allowing Jack Smith To Spy On The Senate
item.description: Calls to impeach Boasberg have been growing louder, with Rep. Brandon Gill, R-Texas, filing Articles of Impeachment earlier this month.

item.title: ‘Most Blatant Exercise Of Judicial Activism’: Federal Judge Rips 2-1 Ruling Striking Down TX Congressional Map
item.description: Smith called the majority's ruling the "most blatant exercise of judicial activism" that he has "ever witnessed."

item.title: Sen. Ernst Introduces Bill To End Blue States’ Fast-Food SNAP Abuse
item.description: Sen. Ernst introduced a bill that seeks to cut off a SNAP loophole that's allowed users to spend benefits at fast-food restaurant chains.

item.title: The Sordid Olivia Nuzzi Saga, Explained
item.description: All the worst people you know are back again.
